description._content: The centerpiece of Swoon's table will be made entirely of cut paper, some geometric shapes more reminiscent of ice shards, rope and snowflakes; and some more representational shapes of animals, sea creatures and architecture. The overall effect will be true to Swoon's style which is to say textural, layered and whimsical and similar in style to "Ice Queen," pictured here, which debuted at LA MoCA's Art in the Streets exhibition. On Wednesday evening, April 18, 2012, the Brooklyn Museum will host its annual fundraising gala, the Brooklyn Artists Ball. This year’s ball will celebrate women artists and recognize the fifth anniversary of the Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art. Guests will dine at table environments created for the occasion by sixteen Brooklyn women artists selected by the Museum’s curators. Each artist will transform a 40-foot-long table into a new work of art that will be on view for one night only. Brooklyn Artists Ball April 18, 2012 www.brooklynmuseum.org/calendar/event/5132
